content: block stitch scarf for this pattern you will need around 200g of your main colour and 50g of a contrast colour you can use any dk weight yarn for this pattern and a 4mm hook i used a variegated yarn for an ombré effect you can use any 2 contrasting yarns this pattern is written in uk terms with us terms in the parentheses chain the width of your scarf in a multiple of two i chained 50 treble_crochet double_crochet into the 5th chain from the hook the first 4 chains count as the first treble_crochet double_crochet stitch treble_crochet double_crochet until the end of the chain fasten_off attach your contrast yarn double_crochet single_crochet into the top of the first chain 4 chain 2 skip 2 stitches and double_crochet single_crochet into the 3rd stitch repeat *skip 2 and double_crochet single_crochet into the 3rd stitch* until the end fasten_off change to main colour and attach yarn in the 1st double_crochet single_crochet 3 treble_crochet double_crochet into the chain 2 space repeat * 3 treble_crochet double_crochet into the chain 2 spaces* until the end fasten_off repeat contrast row *double_crochet single_crochet ch2 skip 2* until the end fasten_off repeat main row chain 3 into 1st double_crochet single_crochet * 3 treble_crochet double_crochet into the ch2 space* until the end fasten_off repeat these 2 row until you reach your desired scarf length i kept going until i had 1 complete colour change in my scarf but yours can be as long or short as you like weave in your many many ends and your scarf is done credits to my pattern testers stopitharry on ravelry thanks so much
